outputs.output_descr: The project's objective is to graduate families in oPt from deep poverty and help them become self-sufficient. THE PROJECT will carry out interventions in different economic sectors to economically empower the poor households.

Scholarships to Palestinians - 305students + 20 international schoolarships+ grants for DEEP families + extra curricular activities; afterscjhool activities+grans to Univ for advisory services+soft skills dev & leadership + economic empowerment to the students families ... etc- contribution from IDB + Sheikha Mozeh foundation

The social development project which was approved under the Japanese fund targets the disadvantaged women, disabled and elderly.This project has the same components of  the ones under DEEP and the total economic empowerment interventions is 480 Interventions
The project's objective is to provide families in oPt with micro and small projects and to graduate them from deep poverty and help them become self-sufficient.

DEEP-Women Entrepreneurs 
Expected CP Outcome(s):	Targeted Palestinian women entrepreneurs belonging to low income families from Gaza, Area C and East Jerusalem can access needed financial and technical resources to start their businesses, and adopt positive and sustainable livelihoods strategies.
Expected Output(s):	1) Targeted women receive business development services and technical support to start their businesses 
2) Targeted women have access to relevant finance schemes to establish or develop their own business
Executing Entity:		UNDP/PAPP United Nations development Program/Program of 					Assistance to the Palestinian People (PAPP).
Implementing Agencies:	UNDP/PAPP in close cooperation with Ministry of Social Affairs, micro-finance institutions, civil society organizations, and the private sector.


Program Period:		2012-2015. 
                                                                 Commencement Date: Jan.1st, 2013. Closing Date: Dec. 31st, 2015
Project Document:                            December 2nd 2012 (Final Revision)

Sector: 				Micro Enterprise Development -Poverty Reduction


Total resources required:  	USD$ 9.48 million.

Donor Contribution:  		USD 6 million

UNDP Contribution: 		USD 3.48 million
DEEP PHASE II- SAME CONDITIONS & SAME GMS  FOR PHASE I & PHASE II APPLIES, EXCEPT THAT THE DISTRIBUTION OF GMS IN ATLAS DIFFERS AND THE FUND IS 30000 WHILE FOR PHASE I IT WAS 40500

project_descr: DEPRIVED fAMILIES ECONOMIC EMPOWERMENT PROGRAMME DEEP to empower and graduate the depressed & deprived Palestinian families (cronic & hard hit poor ) from being receipients of humanitarian assistance to providers of income.
